title: Mere Christianity
summary: A classic defense of the Christian faith, drawing from Lewis's wartime radio broadcasts.

title: The Great Divorce
summary: An allegorical tale exploring the afterlife and the nature of heaven and hell.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
summary: Four children enter a magical world where they join the fight against a dark queen.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Bilbo Baggins sets out on an unexpected journey to reclaim a mountain from a dragon.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
summary: The first part of The Lord of the Rings, where Frodo begins his quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Silmarillion
summary: A posthumous collection of mythopoeic stories about the creation and early ages of Middle-earth.

title: Crime and Punishment
summary: A troubled young man commits murder and wrestles with guilt and morality.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
summary: A profound exploration of faith, free will, and morality through the lives of three brothers.

title: Notes from Underground
summary: A bitter and introspective monologue from an unnamed narrator living in isolation.

title: Man and His Symbols
summary: An accessible introduction to Jungian thought and the role of symbols in the psyche.

title: Psychological Types
summary: A foundational work that introduced Jung’s theory of introversion and extraversion.

title: The Archetypes and the Collective Unconscious
summary: An in-depth exploration of the symbolic content of the human unconscious.

title: The Varieties of Religious Experience
summary: A pioneering psychological and philosophical study of religion and spirituality.

title: Pragmatism: A New Name for Some Old Ways of Thinking
summary: A presentation of James's pragmatic philosophy, emphasizing truth as a process.

title: The Principles of Psychology
summary: An influential textbook that laid the foundation for modern psychology.

title: The Shimmering Bridge
summary: A symbolic journey across realms of doubt and wonder, told through poetic fantasy.

title: Ashes of the North
summary: An exiled sage battles the forces of spiritual decay in a world teetering on collapse.

title: The Sky Library
summary: In a floating city of scrolls and stars, a boy unlocks the truths buried in forgotten stories.

title: Letters to a Young Mormon
summary: A modern take on faith, agency, and discipleship written to inspire young Latter-day Saints.

title: Nothing New Under the Sun
summary: A poetic paraphrase and meditation on the book of Ecclesiastes.

title: Future Mormon
summary: Thought-provoking essays exploring grace, history, and LDS identity.

title: The Inexhaustible Gospel
summary: A powerful collection of discourses on the Savior, personal discipleship, and divine love.

title: Not My Will, But Thine
summary: Reflections on submitting to the Lord’s will and walking the path of faith.

title: Meek and Lowly
summary: Insights on humility and the quiet strength of discipleship.
